summary: The SNAP Study Act of 2025 mandates that the Secretary of Agriculture submit an annual report to Congress. This report must analyze food security and diet quality in the U.S., focusing on the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). It will examine the impact of SNAP changes on participants and non-participants, and offer recommendations to improve nutrition outcomes. The report is due one year after the Act's effective date and annually thereafter, with the Act becoming effective 180 days after enactment.
